intro: Humboltia atropurpurea, commonly known as the purple-hummingbird plant, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of California and Baja California. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its striking purple-pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with woody stems and dark green, ovate leaves. Its flowers are tubular and bilaterally symmetrical, adapted for pollination by hummingbirds. Humboltia atropurpurea is also known for its ability to thrive in coastal climates with well-drained soils and full sun exposure.
